==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
[[oracle bone script|Oracle bone script]]: {{Han compound|來|子|ls=psc|c1=p|c2=s|t1=fruit}}. The phonetic part {{lang|zh|來}} became gradually corrupted to yield {{zh-l|*木|tree}}.

''{{w|Shuowen}}'' erroneously remarks that this is a {{Han compound|木|子|c1=s|c2=p|t1=tree|ls=psc|nocap=1}}.

===Definitions===
{{zh-hanzi}}

# [[plum]] {{gloss|[[tree]] and [[fruit]]}}
# {{lb|zh|astronomy}} {{w|Zeta Virginis}}
# {{†}} {{zh-alt-form|理|[[judge]]; [[justice]]}}
# {{surname|lang=zh|dot=,}} listed fourth in the ''{{w|Baijiaxing}}''

====Usage notes====
In mainland China or among its expatriates, this name is generally romanized "[[Li]]" in accordance with the {{w|Hanyu Pinyin}} system. Although an identical transliteration is used in {{w|Wade-Giles}}, similarity to the English name has made the romanization "[[Lee]]" more common in Hong Kong and Taiwan. A notable example to this is {{w|Bruce Lee}}.

====Descendants====
* English: {{l|en|Li}}, {{l|en|Lee}}
* Tagalog: {{q|from Hokkien}} {{l|tl|Sy}}
